channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Kast’s Victory in Chile Is Another Win for Global Right-Wing Movement
item.description: José Antonio Kast, who was elected president on Sunday, is the latest conservative to rise to power promising strict law and order measures.

item.title: Trial to Start for Judge Accused of Helping Undocumented Immigrant Evade Agents
item.description: The Milwaukee County judge faces federal charges, but she has maintained her innocence.

item.title: A Massacre in Australia, and Rob Reiner Is Found Dead in ‘Apparent Homicide’
item.description: Plus, the hunt for the gunman in a shooting at Brown University.

item.title: Fed chair favorite Kevin Hassett on potential independence from Trump: ‘His opinion matters if it’s good, if it’s based on data’
item.description: On Friday, Trump said he “certainly should have a role" in Fed policy. "I’ve done great. I’ve made a lot of money ... I think my voice should be heard...

item.title: Trump’s Cuts Hobbled US Labor Board, Leaving Festering Disputes and a Power Struggle
item.description: Advocates fear damage to labor protections if the Supreme Court upholds the president’s move to control federal agency staffing.

item.title: Deloitte’s CTO on a stunning AI transformation stat: companies are spending 93% on tech and only 7% on people
item.description: Bill Briggs recognizes an old inertia inside the boardroom: "I felt it in my travels, but I hadn't been able to quantify it."

item.title: Rob Reiner, comedy legend who directed ‘When Harry Met Sally’ and ‘Spinal Tap,’ dead at 78
item.description: Reiner and his wife, Michele Singer, were found dead Sunday at their home in the Brentwood neighborhood of Los Angeles.

item.title: Italian cuisine, and even the rituals surrounding it, get an official UNESCO world heritage designation
item.description: “This tradition of being at the table, of stopping for a while at lunch, a bit longer at dinner ... it’s not very common around the world."

item.title: Making nightmares into reality: AI finds fans in the Islamic State, other militant and terrorist other groups worldwide
item.description: “One of the best things about AI is how easy it is to use,” said someone on a pro-IS site last month.

item.title: Live Updates: Australian Police Plan to Charge Suspect in Bondi Massacre
item.description: Officials said a father and son killed at least 15 people at a Jewish holiday celebration. More than three dozen others were hospitalized, including a...

item.title: The Turbulent Times of Friedrich Merz
item.description: The new chancellor believes the world needs a stronger Germany. He is still navigating how to do it.

item.title: Kast’s Victory in Chile Is Another Win for Global Right-Wing Movement
item.description: José Antonio Kast, who was elected president on Sunday, is the latest conservative to rise to power promising strict law and order measures.

item.title: Olivia Dean, Josh Johnson and Chase Infiniti Are Among Our 2025 Breakout Stars
item.description: Across the arts, these 10 performers took a leap of faith this year and stuck the landing in a big way.

item.title: How the Bondi Beach Community Rushed to Help Shooting Victims
item.description: I lived and worked around Bondi for years. The emergency response tells you everything you need to know about the area.
